quiz.title: Unit 2: 1D Kinematics (Quiz 12)
quiz.subtitle: Relative Motion and Vector Problems (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: An aircraft is cruising with an airspeed of $240\text{ m s}^{-1}$ directed due North. During its flight, it enters a region with a consistent crosswind blowing from the West at a speed of $50\text{ m s}^{-1}$. Calculate the resultant velocity of the aircraft relative to the ground.

An aircraft is cruising with an airspeed of $240\text{ m s}^{-1}$ directed due North. During its flight, it enters a region with a consistent crosswind blowing from the West at a speed of $50\text{ m s}^{-1}$. The pilot now intends to maintain a ground track that is due North. Determine the bearing the pilot must point the aircraft's nose.
questions.explanation: To cancel East wind, plane must point West of North: $\sin\theta = 50/240 = 0.2083$ â‡’ $\theta = 12.0^\circ$ West of North.

questions.question: A train travels at a constant velocity of $20\text{ m/s}$ due West relative to the Earth. John, who is inside, jogs toward the back of the train at $2\text{ m/s}$ due East relative to the carriage. Calculate John's velocity relative to the Earth.
A van travels $120\text{ m}$ due West in $10\text{ seconds}$, then turns and travels $160\text{ m}$ due North in $8\text{ seconds}$. Calculate the van's average velocity for the entire journey.
questions.explanation: Displacement = $\sqrt{120^2+160^2}=200$ m at $\tan^{-1}(160/120)=53.1^\circ$ North of West. Time = 18 s. Avg velocity = $200/18 = 11.1$ m/s.

questions.question: A ferry can travel at $8\text{ m/s}$ in still water. If the river current is $3\text{ m/s}$ downstream, calculate the ferry's velocity relative to the riverbank when moving downstream.
A ferry can travel at $8\text{ m/s}$ in still water. If the river current is $3\text{ m/s}$ downstream, calculate the ferry's velocity relative to the riverbank when moving upstream.
Car A travels at $110\text{ km/h}$ East, and Car B travels at $90\text{ km/h}$ West. What is the velocity of Car A relative to a passenger sitting in Car B?
An airport walkway moves at $1.5\text{ m/s}$ North. A traveler walks on it at $2.0\text{ m/s}$ South relative to the walkway. What is the traveler's velocity relative to the terminal floor?
A runner completes a $400\text{ m}$ circular track in $80\text{ seconds}$, ending exactly where they started. Calculate the runner's average velocity.
questions.explanation: Displacement = 0 (returns to start). Average velocity = $0/80 = 0$ m/s.

questions.question: A runner completes a $400\text{ m}$ circular track in $80\text{ seconds}$, ending exactly where they started. Calculate the runner's average speed.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered relative motion and vector addition problems.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review the difference between average speed and average velocity.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on setting up coordinate systems and adding vectors correctly.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study relative velocity formulas and practice vector addition carefully.
